intro: Diphysa punctata, commonly known as the spotted diphysa, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmately lobed leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Diphysa punctata is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and delicate blooms.
